events.name: Military coup in Burkina Faso
events.wd_description: The military coup in Burkina Faso deposed President Roch Kabore, prompted by demands for better security and increased instability in the region.
events.description: The military coup in Burkina Faso deposed President Roch Kabore, prompted by demands for better security and increased instability in the region.

events.name: President deposed
events.wd_description: Mutinous soldiers announced the deposition of President Roch Kabore amid demands for more support in fighting armed groups.
events.description: Mutinous soldiers announced the deposition of President Roch Kabore amid demands for more support in fighting armed groups.

events.name: soldier mutiny
events.wd_description: Soldiers demanded more support for their fight against armed groups and subsequently deposed President Kabore.
events.description: Soldiers demanded more support for their fight against armed groups and subsequently deposed President Kabore.

events.name: popular support
events.wd_description: The coup was greeted with significant support in Burkina Faso.
events.description: The coup was greeted with significant support in Burkina Faso.

events.name: military leadership
events.wd_description: Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba emerged as the leader of the coup and was named the leader of the new Patriotic Movement for Safeguard and Restoration (MPSR).
events.description: Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba emerged as the leader of the coup and was named the leader of the new Patriotic Movement for Safeguard and Restoration (MPSR).

events.name: rise in violence
events.wd_description: Burkina Faso has experienced a significant increase in violence from armed groups linked to al-Qaeda and ISIL.
events.description: Burkina Faso has experienced a significant increase in violence from armed groups linked to al-Qaeda and ISIL.

events.name: armed groups
events.wd_description: Armed groups linked to al-Qaeda and ISIL have been operating in Burkina Faso since 2015.
events.description: Armed groups linked to al-Qaeda and ISIL have been operating in Burkina Faso since 2015.

events.name: increased attacks
events.wd_description: The number of attacks has risen significantly, with over 1,150 incidents in 2021 compared to nearly 500 in 2020.
events.description: The number of attacks has risen significantly, with over 1,150 incidents in 2021 compared to nearly 500 in 2020.

events.name: civilian displacement
events.wd_description: More than 1.4 million people have been displaced by the conflict in Burkina Faso.
events.description: More than 1.4 million people have been displaced by the conflict in Burkina Faso.

events.name: international reactions
events.wd_description: The coup has sparked widespread international condemnation and prompted discussions on how to respond to the instability.
events.description: The coup has sparked widespread international condemnation and prompted discussions on how to respond to the instability.

events.name: international condemnation
events.wd_description: The international community, including various countries and organizations, has condemned the coup.
events.description: The international community, including various countries and organizations, has condemned the coup.

events.name: ECOWAS response
events.wd_description: The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) is holding a special session to discuss the coup and potential responses.
events.description: The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) is holding a special session to discuss the coup and potential responses.

events.name: potential sanctions
events.wd_description: Western allies are considering imposing sanctions on Burkina Faso in response to the coup.
events.description: Western allies are considering imposing sanctions on Burkina Faso in response to the coup.

events.name: regional instability
events.wd_description: The coup is the fourth in a series of recent military takeovers in West and Central Africa, contributing to regional instability.
events.description: The coup is the fourth in a series of recent military takeovers in West and Central Africa, contributing to regional instability.

events.name: North Korea missile tests
events.wd_description: Beginning on January 5, North Korea initiated a new round of missile tests over the Sea of Japan, aiming to circumvent American and Japanese missile defense technologies.
events.description: Beginning on January 5, North Korea initiated a new round of missile tests over the Sea of Japan, aiming to circumvent American and Japanese missile defense technologies.

events.name: missile tests
events.wd_description: North Korea began missile tests over the Sea of Japan on January 5.
events.description: North Korea began missile tests over the Sea of Japan on January 5.

events.name: defense circumvention
events.wd_description: The missile tests are targeted toward circumventing American and Japanese missile defense technologies in the region.
events.description: The missile tests are targeted toward circumventing American and Japanese missile defense technologies in the region.

events.name: diplomatic preemption
events.wd_description: Some analysts suspect the missile tests are intended to preempt a new push for diplomatic engagement with the U.S.
events.description: Some analysts suspect the missile tests are intended to preempt a new push for diplomatic engagement with the U.S.

events.name: sanctions
events.wd_description: The U.S. has leveraged severe sanctions against North Korea due to its missile programs.
events.description: The U.S. has leveraged severe sanctions against North Korea due to its missile programs.

events.name: Forest Fires near Chernobyl Nuclear Reactor
events.wd_label: Forest Fires near Chernobyl Nuclear Reactor
events.wd_description: Forest fires have erupted near the Chernobyl nuclear reactor, with Ukrainian authorities claiming that Russian control of the area is hampering efforts to control the flames.
events.description: Forest fires have erupted near the Chernobyl nuclear reactor, with Ukrainian authorities claiming that Russian control of the area is hampering efforts to control the flames.

events.name: Fire Outbreak
events.wd_description: At least seven fires have been spotted within Chernobyl’s exclusion zone, likely ignited by the armed aggression of the Russian Federation.
events.description: At least seven fires have been spotted within Chernobyl’s exclusion zone, likely ignited by the armed aggression of the Russian Federation.

events.name: Causes of Fires
events.wd_description: The fires may have been caused by shelling, arson, or other factors related to the armed aggression of the Russian Federation.
events.description: The fires may have been caused by shelling, arson, or other factors related to the armed aggression of the Russian Federation.

events.name: Satellite Imagery Confirmation
events.wd_description: Satellite imagery taken by the European Space Agency confirmed the presence of at least seven fires within the exclusion zone.
events.description: Satellite imagery taken by the European Space Agency confirmed the presence of at least seven fires within the exclusion zone.

events.name: Impact on Radiation Levels
events.wd_description: The fires within 10km of the Chernobyl plant are particularly dangerous, with concerns about the potential release of radioactive material.
events.description: The fires within 10km of the Chernobyl plant are particularly dangerous, with concerns about the potential release of radioactive material.

events.name: Historical Radiation Spikes
events.wd_description: In 2020, a forest fire near the reactor caused radiation levels to spike to 16 times above normal.
events.description: In 2020, a forest fire near the reactor caused radiation levels to spike to 16 times above normal.

events.name: Current Monitoring Challenges
events.wd_description: Ukrainian authorities claim that the ongoing war is hindering attempts to monitor radiation levels, making it difficult to respond to potential threats.
events.description: Ukrainian authorities claim that the ongoing war is hindering attempts to monitor radiation levels, making it difficult to respond to potential threats.

events.name: Response and Challenges
events.wd_description: Ukrainian firefighters are unable to tackle the blazes due to Russian presence, and there are concerns about the safety and monitoring of the site.
events.description: Ukrainian firefighters are unable to tackle the blazes due to Russian presence, and there are concerns about the safety and monitoring of the site.

events.name: Firefighting Efforts
events.wd_description: Ukrainian firefighters are unable to control the fires due to the presence of Russian forces in the area.
events.description: Ukrainian firefighters are unable to control the fires due to the presence of Russian forces in the area.

events.name: Safety Concerns
events.wd_description: There are concerns that fierce fighting in the area could damage the reactor further and cause radioactive material to escape.
events.description: There are concerns that fierce fighting in the area could damage the reactor further and cause radioactive material to escape.

events.name: Climate Change Factors
events.wd_description: Climate scientists have pointed out that rising temperatures due to global heating are causing forests to dry out, making them more susceptible to fires.
events.description: Climate scientists have pointed out that rising temperatures due to global heating are causing forests to dry out, making them more susceptible to fires.

events.name: Climate Change Impact
events.wd_description: Warmer temperatures are causing bigger fire seasons around the world, which may mobilize radioactive particles from the Chernobyl region.
events.description: Warmer temperatures are causing bigger fire seasons around the world, which may mobilize radioactive particles from the Chernobyl region.

events.name: Future Risks
events.wd_description: The rapidly changing climate and the presence of large amounts of dead, fire-prone wood in the Chernobyl region pose a high risk of radioactive contamination from future fires.
events.description: The rapidly changing climate and the presence of large amounts of dead, fire-prone wood in the Chernobyl region pose a high risk of radioactive contamination from future fires.

events.name: EV battery supply chain challenges
events.wd_description: Challenges in the EV battery supply chain include the sourcing of raw materials, the manufacturing capacity, and political factors affecting long-term planning.
events.description: Challenges in the EV battery supply chain include the sourcing of raw materials, the manufacturing capacity, and political factors affecting long-term planning.

events.name: sourcing raw materials
events.wd_description: The US sources about 90% of its lithium from Argentina and Chile, while China refines a significant portion of the world's lithium and cobalt.
events.description: The US sources about 90% of its lithium from Argentina and Chile, while China refines a significant portion of the world's lithium and cobalt.

events.name: lithium sourcing
events.wd_description: The US sources approximately 90% of its lithium from Argentina and Chile.
events.description: The US sources approximately 90% of its lithium from Argentina and Chile.

events.name: cobalt refining
events.wd_description: China refines 60% of the world's lithium and 80% of the cobalt, which are critical for electric vehicles.
events.description: China refines 60% of the world's lithium and 80% of the cobalt, which are critical for electric vehicles.

events.name: manufacturing capacity
events.wd_description: The US lacks the manufacturing capacity for electric vehicle batteries and struggles to create a long-term plan for it.
events.description: The US lacks the manufacturing capacity for electric vehicle batteries and struggles to create a long-term plan for it.

events.name: political factors
events.wd_description: The US's long-term planning for electric batteries is hindered by shifting priorities based on political party control.
events.description: The US's long-term planning for electric batteries is hindered by shifting priorities based on political party control.

events.name: mining projects
events.wd_description: The Biden administration has halted mining projects in Arizona and Minnesota that would boost domestic supply of electric vehicle materials.
events.description: The Biden administration has halted mining projects in Arizona and Minnesota that would boost domestic supply of electric vehicle materials.

events.name: administration policies
events.wd_description: The Biden administration pushes for electric vehicles while also halting key mining projects.
events.description: The Biden administration pushes for electric vehicles while also halting key mining projects.
